zone.line: The poor old servant who was
with me endeavoured to persuade me
to remain here and to let him go alone
– I shook my head silently and sadly;
sick almost to death I leant upon his
arm, and as there was no road for a
chaise dragged my weary steps across
the desolate downs to meet my fate,
now too certain for the agony of doubt.
Almost fainting I slowly approached
the fatal waters; when we had quitted
the town we heard thear their roaring
I whispered to my self in a muttering
voice – How "The sound is the same as
that which I heard in my dream." It is
the knell of my father which I hear."
The rain had ceased; there was
no more thunder and lightning; the
wind had paused. My heart no longer
beat wildly; I did not feel any fever:
but I was chilled; my knees a sunk
under me – I almost slept as I walked
